objects.name: smooth operator
objects.description: macOS supply-chain malware distributed via trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX Desktop App installers. Smooth Operator is two-stage: a malicious constructor in libffmpeg.dylib (first-stage) spawns a thread and downloads/executes a second-stage payload (UpdateAgent). It targets 64-bit Intel macOS, generates a UUID victim ID, persists as part of the 3CX software, sleeps an initial 7–20 days before beaconing, and then periodically beacons. Communication uses HTTPS C2 with a custom two-step data obfuscation (1-byte XOR 0x7A for stored C2s and a validCharList-based encoding for beacons/exfiltration). The malware randomizes among an embedded list of C2 URLs (including a 3CX website fallback after repeated errors), supports tasking commands (including writing and executing arbitrary payloads via UpdateAgent and popen), deletes the second-stage after execution, and automatically collects and exfiltrates victim-specific 3CX configuration and system information.

objects.name: 3CX
objects.description: Vendor of the 3CX Desktop App; its legitimate-signed and notarized installers were trojanised and used to distribute Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Apple
objects.description: Platform vendor that provides macOS signing and notarization; the trojanised 3CX package was reported as signed and notarized by Apple.

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique strings and code
present in the C2 string obfuscation code of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:

    $ = {48 69 ?? 61 60 60 60 48 89 ?? 48 C1 EA 3F 48 C1 ?? 25 01

?? 6B ?? 55}

$ = "!#$%&()*+ -\n\n.0123456789:;<>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[]_abcdefghi"
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26706572} // &per
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26646F6C} // &dol
$ = {75733E00C7[5-6]26706C75} // &plus
$ = {6D693E00C7[5-6]2673656D} // &semi

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique code sections in the
C2 string obfuscation algorithm."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $a_1 = {4869C8616060604889CA48C1EA3F48C1F92501D16BC95529C8[0-3]83F807}
        $b_1 = {438D1C24F7DB41F7DC} // neg
        $b_2 = {478D3C3641F7DF41F7DE} // neg

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of ($b*)
and $a_1
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies broader functionality across
Smooth Operator, identifying strings observed throughout."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:
        $ = {80 [2] 7A 48 FF C0 48 83 F8 38} // .main_storage XOR loop
        $ = "<key>ProductVersion</key>"
        $ = ".session-lock"
        $ = "%s/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/UpdateAgent"
        $ =
{3715001316161B554F544A5A522D13141E150D095A342E5A4B4A544A415A2D13144C4E41
5A024C4E535A3B0A0A161F2D1F1831130E554F494D54494C5A5231322E3736565A1613111
F5A3D1F191115535A39120815171F554B4A42544A544F494F43544B48425A291B1C1B0813
554F494D54494C} // XOR'd UA
        $ = {B02D[0-8]88470888470D884712884717C6472400} // victim ID
generation

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 4 of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_C2_codes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_C2_codes {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies sections of code which are
responsible for parsing tasking command codes in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ = {80340F7A48FFC14839C8} // XOR deobfuscate tasking

        $ = {8B073D4938000074??3D018000008B4C24??0F[3-6]3D01900000} // C2
codes

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Sleeps
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Sleeps {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies algorithms used by the malware developer to generate
random time values in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ =

{E8[4]E8[4]89C14869C93FC5254348C1E9246BC93D29C86BE83C81C5100E0000B80F0000
00} // between beacon time generation

$ = {E8[4]E8[4]89C1490FAFCE48C1E9238D0C898D0C4929C8} // C2 index
$ =

{89E8D1E841BE932449924C0FAFF049C1EE224489F0C1E0044489F129C14101EE4101CE48
8DBC24[4]4C892FE8} // initial sleep

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_II
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_II {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies strings observed in the second-stage of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $ = "3cx_auth_id=%s;3cx_auth_token_content=%s;__tutma=true"

  $ = "AccountName\":"

        $ = "url\": \"https://"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop\nApp/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/config.json"
        $ = "read_config"
        $ = "enc_text"
        $ = "send_post"
        $ = "parse_json_config"

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 5 of them
}

objects.name: Supply Chain Compromise: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
objects.description: Smooth Operator was distributed via legitimate channels as trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software, representing a supply-chain compromise of software dependencies or development tools.

objects.name: Compromise Client Software Binary
objects.description: Smooth Operator runs as part of the 3CX software by abusing a legitimate component (libffmpeg.dylib) so the malicious code executes whenever the library is loaded.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Smooth Operator uses a custom algorithm to obfuscate data exfiltrated over the C2 channel; it deobfuscates data it writes to files on disk as well as tasking responses.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: The second-stage deletes itself from disk immediately on execution.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
objects.description: Smooth Operator sleeps for, at minimum, a week before beaconing to evade sandbox or automated analysis environments.

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Smooth Operator stages collect data from the victim machine (OS version, hostname, beacon interval, C2 index, 3CX config values) to include in beacons or exfiltration.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Smooth Operator uses HTTPS for command-and-control communication and beacons.

objects.name: Fallback Channels
objects.description: Smooth Operator contains multiple C2 servers and randomly chooses a new server from the list for each beacon; if many invalid responses occur it falls back to an embedded 3CX URL.

objects.name: Automated Exfiltration
objects.description: Smooth Operator exfiltrates automatically collected data (including extracted domain and account name from 3CX config.json and victim ID) to a dedicated exfiltration endpoint over HTTPS.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Smooth Operator
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. smooth operator.
